Reviews.Title: “Affordable hotel in an exclusive part of London”
Reviews.Author: wonder-luster
Reviews.Content: We checked in in to this hotel midway through our London stay because the hot water in our apartment was not working. The hotel was within walking distance from Gloucester Rd Station in a very quiet and safe neighborhood with many amenities nearby ( Waitrose, pubs, restaurants etc ) We paid 125 GBP for a triple sharing room and ( 135 GBP triple for walk in ). The hotel has 24 hr counter service, equipped with a lift and provides a luggage hold area for customers with late flights out of London. Our room at 107 was amply spacious, heated and quiet ( facing a courtyard ). The bathroom was fairly old but water pressure was good and simple toiletries were provided. Continental breakfast was included in the stay. The only problem perhaps would be that the TV reception was rather poor with regular reception problems. Overall, it is a great location at a good price and is ideal if you need do a short stay in London.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Gizelle_Paiva
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 13 days in February, 2011. I had a nice time there. The hotel is well located, in a quiet street, close to Gloucester Road Tube Station, Waitrose and some restaurants. The breakfast (included in the price) was ok, not the best of my life, but not the worst one. Coffe, tea, toasts and jam. Unfortunately the wi-fi only works at the reception, not in the rooms, which isn't very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: keeleykins
Reviews.Content: Make sure to ask for a room to the back, we were in the front for the first night and got no sleep at all. The staff were lovely and very helpful they moved us the minute we asked. To be honest the hotel is a bit of a warren, but you get what you pay for. The breakfast was fine and the location great. We had some good meals in local restaruants.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, 50-50 on the rest”
Reviews.Author: TeeBow
Reviews.Content: London seems in a class by itself when it comes to a hotel. Either they are not good or very expensive, this hotel fits somewhat into that category. When I arrived and was checking in a couple came to the desk and requested a room change as their room was "not acceptable"(not sure what the issue was). The woman at the desk told them there are no more rooms, 5 minutes later they were checking out so I was concerned. However, my room was adequate, small, a bit worn, but clean. The showers were fine, the bed was not great but ok. The breakfast is ok, nothing to write home about. The staff were friendly. I think for the price you can not do better, only worse, at least that has been my experience over the years in London (go 1-2x a year).

Reviews.Title: “With kids in London”
Reviews.Author: Eppiegrande
Reviews.Content: The location of the Hotel is superb. Just a few minutes from South Kensington station. A lat of restaurants in the neighbourhood. The hotel itself has a friendly staff and are helpfull. We booked on the hotel site for 2 adults and 2 children. An email is the room would be big enough for 4 was not answered. When we arrived, the room was too small for 4, but was resolved instantly by changing the room. Breakfast is simple (toast, jams, cheese, yoghurt some cornflakes, coffee, thee, milk and orange-juice) Don't expect croissants for the price. Al in all a good location, fair price. We would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a budget hotel in London”
Reviews.Author: melenemel
Reviews.Content: Having previously spent a night in a truly appalling hotel for the same rate just a couple of miles away, we weren't expecting too much for our money and so were pleasantly surprised by the Cranley Gardens Hotel. Our room was a reasonable size and had everything we needed for our stay. Staff on the front desk were very helpful when we needed to extend our stay and this was very much appreciated, and our only problem was with a somewhat erratic lift which seemed to disregard the 4th floor which was unfortunate as that was the floor we needed. But that was a very minor irritation. Breakfast was basic but quite adequate (coffee was fantastic!) and all things considered, we were perfectly happy with the quality of our accommodation. If you take into account that you are in Chelsea and that you would be paying at least 50% more for any other accommodation in the area, I really don't think there is anything to quibble about. As has already been said elsewhere, if you want 5 stars you will have to pay for it!

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: craig a
Reviews.Content: Just see phantom at the royal albert hall booked the cranley so we could walk to the threatre yes it is in need of some money spending on the bedrooms but it was clean and tidy the staff were very helpful and as it was 50.00 pounds cheaper than anything around it a good job done for the money if you are looking for 5 stars then book the hilton !

Reviews.Title: “You get what you paid for”
Reviews.Author: Shake84
Reviews.Content: I stayed here almost 3 weeks ago for 2 nights, and that was more than enough for me. When checking in, the man at the reception was rude and impatient, which was a very bad start (although I have to say the other members of staff were much nicer). There was a balcony, which i was pleasantly surprised by, until i saw the chain on the door and a sign that says that it could not be used. The space between where you put your luggage and the foot of the bed is so small (didn't help that i was traveling with a large suitcase though) that i literally had to climb over the bed to get from one end of the room to the other. Basically, I just stayed there because the location was next to where family was staying and i reasoned that it was only for 2 nights, but I will not be making that mistake again.

Reviews.Title: “Small room, but good value.”
Reviews.Author: krazykim003
Reviews.Content: This hotel had all the basics you need. Beds, shower, dresser and a closet in the room, even though it was a bit small. The hotel had a computer to use for internet (very very slow!), and even had a breakfast in the morning. It was located in a decent part of town right near the Science Museum and Natural History Museum. Also, it is conveniently right down the street from a tube station. I would say this hotel is a very good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff, Great Value, Tucked Away”
Reviews.Author: Finrep001
Reviews.Content: You are staying in a very nice residential neighborhood adjacent to wonderful Chelsea London. However, a very short walk and you are in the bustle of either the South Kensington or Gloucester Road tube stations, meaning you are excellently placed to transportation, shopping, dining, etc. I have stayed here for leisure many times and recommended it to others who have never complained. This is not a technologically advanced hotel; there is a PC with free Internet in the lobby, the rooms have small TVs with the basic four UK Channels, the rooms are small but not tiny by UK standards, furnishings are plain and have been around a while. Breakfast is free and simple, or you can opt to pay for a cooked breakfast, and yes the elevator is small and slow. However, the staff is very helpful and friendly. I find the Cranley Gardens Hotel quaint and quiet and feel like a resident versus a tourist or business person. Rooms start at Â£75 per night for a single room. If you are particular and want larger rooms with nice TVs and lots of channels and pay-as-you-go Internet access, you can manage it elsewhere for Â£140 per night; however, you could easily find yourself paying Â£240 per night. For the price, this is an excellent value hotel in a great neighborhood very well placed for efficiently travelling around London or travelling to Heathrow Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: snowhite22
Reviews.Content: The first room we were assigned overlooked a roof and was very poky - quite unlike the photographs on the website. We refused it and were shown a marginally bigger one in the front overlooking the garden. But the room was very poorly equipped - not even glasses in the bathroom. It was tight and the bathroom was old and worn. There were no tea or coffee facilities and the safe did not work. One day were went out early and only returned late in the afternoon to find our room had not been made up! The Internet simply didn't work. The best thing about the hotel is the location and neighborhood and the public spaces downstairs were quite nice, though nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: Leahlumsdaine
Reviews.Content: My family booked this hotel because the location seemed great and the photos on the website looked pleasant and with a continental breakfast the price was reasonable for the area. Â£105 for a double room. When I walked into our double room I was horrified. It smelt dirty. The bathroom was tiny and had a tiny light above the sink. It took us about 10 minutes to get the shower working and even then the fixture was stuck on the wall so you couldn't pull it off. My grandma is quite short and she could hardly reach the shower head to wash herself in her room . There was no drinking water provided in the rooms so I asked for a bottle of water from the desk... This was then charged on our bill not inclusive with the room price. Our room was on the ground floor and so right next to the road. On the website it stated quiet rooms, our room was not quiet. It's was so hot so we had to open the windows, the curtains were filthy, as was the bed cover. There was a sheet and a filthy blanket and one pillow each. After a bad nights sleep we went to breakfast which we found was not a full continental but only cereal and toast! I was starting to wonder what exactly we were paying for.Â  SomeÂ friends of ours got a room at a five star hotel near by for only Â£20 more including breakfast.Â  When i complained to the receptionist she just gave me a piece of paper and said write it down!Â  The last time I stayed in a place like cranley gardens hotel was in a hostel in magaluf. I would say that the only value was the location. Â I would not recommend it to anyone and I certainly won't be staying here again.Â

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel,”
Reviews.Author: manibainz
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel quite hard to find, it just looks like a big house,fairly close to tube. Check in was fast, I had booked a single room and was given a twin room, room was big but the bathroom wasnt the cleanest without going into to much detail the toilet had a surprise for me! You have to leave the key at reception when going out, so after coming back after anight out, we was waiting a good 15 min to be let in by the night porter! Not a bad hotel, I paid Â£50 but I think the rack rate is higher. Cant comment on the breakfast which was continental inc in room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back to this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: mrfyda
Reviews.Content: Nothing special but for the price was quite acceptable. The room floor could be a bit cleaner. Well located within 10 minutes from the tube and museums. Very friendly staff. Would go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location - Great, Price - Great, Rooms - Okay”
Reviews.Author: Kathleeny
Reviews.Content: We spent a total of three nights, pre and post cruise, at The Cranley Gardens. The location is fantastic. A fairly residential area near enough the Gloucester Road Tube Station, a variety of excellent restaurants, several groceries and a walk to Hyde Park. (Try Rocca di Papa for dinner - just a 5 minute walk. Wonderful service, prices and food and the hotel staff made reservations for our party of 14.) The lobby is small, but comfortable and WiFi works there. The rooms are a reasonable size for Europe, but VERY basic. No extras like additional pillows. The windows open, and we needed that the last night as London was unseasonably HOT. We really were very uncomfortable in the almost 90 degree heat, so think about that if you are going to be there in the summer. Fortunately, it is a fairly quiet neighborhood and the street noise was not terrible, but the heat was oppressive! The triples we had our teenagers in were very well set up and a decent size.. Bathrooms are basic and anyone with mobility issues will need to take care getting in and out of the bathtub. The multiple, very heavy fire doors in all the hallways make going to and from various areas of the hotel or getting to the small lift or stairs a bit of a challenge for anyone who is not fairly agile and able to push them open. (My 80 year old parents had to really push to get through.) We used the stairs mostly as the lift is small and slow. Fortunately we had some big teenage boys with us to haul luggage! Breakfast is cereals, toast, some fruit, cheese, yogurt, juices, coffee and tea. Very adequate and convenient. Overall, for the price and location it is a great choice. If you are looking for extra frills such as fluffy pillows, A/C, more than the BBC on the TV, WiFi in your room, you will need to spend a LOT more cash in London. If you want a wonderful, safe location at a very fair price The Cranley Gardens is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Grim and uncomfortable”
Reviews.Author: pado21
Reviews.Content: Room was grimey and fixtures and fittings were poor and in bad order. I would not recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!”
Reviews.Author: ggtlm
Reviews.Content: I have never ever written a review in my life but I felt compelled to write one about this hotel. I stayed here in early June 2011 alone for what should have been two nights (more about that later). On first impressions it seemed much like any other cheap London hotel. The staff at the reception were friendly and was given room 11 which is on the ground floor. It was ok, smelled slightly but I put this down to the high temperatures outside and the window being closed. Extremely basic and everything could do with replacing but considering the location (amazing), the price I paid (Â£150 for two nights) and the fact that I would only be sleeping there I felt that it would be fine. On the second evening of my stay I went to bed quite early but I awoke at around 10.30pm and switched the light on to find a cockroach on the floor beside my bed. I immediately rang the reception who said they had no other rooms available so I had no other choice but to leave. The hotel agreed to pay for my taxi to another hotel but they have not since had the decency to reply to either my letters or my emails. In hindsight, I made the mistake of not taking any photos but I was horrified and needed to get out of there asap. My advice would be to never stay here no matter how tempted you are by the cheap prices and the excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Great inexpensive place to stay”
Reviews.Author: CitizenoftheWorld23
Reviews.Content: Prior to booking this hotel I read many of the reviews on this site and was frankly quite worried about what I'd find on arrival, but I was pleasantly surprised. The location is perfect, the staff (with one exception) were friendly and helpful, the lobby was nice (there is internet service in the lobby, so I spent a bit of time there each evening), and the room was clean. Sure, the room's decor left a bit to be desired, but I wasn't there often enough for it to pose a problem. It was spring and we left our windows open. It was a nice surprise to be awakened by birdsong. We had a triple room (for myself and my nephew), so there were three twin beds. One of the twin beds was in a separate small room, which is where I slept. It was nice to have privacy even when traveling with family. It was never too hot (windows opened in any case, so either way it would have been fine) or too cold. The beds were comfortable and I slept well. Each bed came with a pillow (rather flat, but I prefer that) and there were two extra pillows and two extra blankets in the wardrobe. We stayed a week and enjoyed every minute of our time at Cranley Gardens. We didn't each breakfast at the hotel. There are lots of restaurants and coffee shops a short walk away and we preferred to be out. I think the people writing these reviews are expecting Doubletree rooms for Motel 6 prices. If a luxurious hotel is what you're looking for, this is probably not the place for you, but if you want to stay in a safe location in the heart of London in a pleasant hotel that is extremely affordable then I wouldn't let the negative reviews scare you away. Just don't expect anything fancy!

Reviews.Title: “Chelseas cheapest, and it shows”
Reviews.Author: wmlxb05
Reviews.Content: Price attracted us here as we needed to be close to the Royal Marsden hospital. The rooms are VERY basic, I've stopped in better rooms in Blackpool B&B's. Saying that however this place is half the price of most accomodation in the area. Breakfast is poor, toast and cereal, staff are good. The area is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Passable. Just.”
Reviews.Author: raaaabert
Reviews.Content: Typical of London hotels, this place reminds you of what it must have been like to find a luxury hotel back in late 1800's. Relative to that era this hotel has it all, a cathode ray television with 4 channels, ironing board (upon request) that does not work, small cupboard safe that you have to pay to use. No wifi, what is this invention wifi you talk of - I do say my dear fellow, it's 1883 and we haven't invented wifi yet. That said the reception wifi works, but not very useful when you need alot of access for work. I think I waited about 10 minutes for the lift at one stage. Breakfast is very very basic, with the toast overlord making sure you don't eat more than the rationed two slices, either that or no one in the 1800's had the competency to work the toaster. Breakfast highlight is the free Daily Mail.

Reviews.Title: “average london cheap hotel”
Reviews.Author: farmerwadey
Reviews.Content: Alas, most cheap (Â£70) hotels are much like this. Always the single rooms are the worst. But teh Cranley Gardens were certainly no worse than most. The receptionist was very frienmdly and helpful. The room was a drab celebration of magnola, wood chip (i may have imagined that) and plastic curtains. i had a digital tv with 4 channels to disctract me from it.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T GO HERE!!!”
Reviews.Author: dustieb45
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as according to the web it looked like a really nice hotel. The pictures it showed of the room looked good. It was for a special occassion as it was my partners birthday and we were going to Foxtrot Oscars for dinner. Firstly on my booking I stated that I had a car and would need parking, just before going I rang the hotel and asked if they would be providing a spaced etc, and was informed that there was no parking and it was first come first served... Kinda ticked me off a bit as they had asked on the booking form if I needed a space. Ok, we get to the hotel, from the outside it looked great, reception was great, the guy behind the counter... maybe no so great, but he might have been having a bad day. We were given 216, went to the lift and my heart sank, tiny, scruffy and looked like it was falling apart. Got the 2nd floor, our room directly opposite the lift, I opened the door and it sank even more, the room was tiny, the nets were grey and I don't know if thats the colour they should have been or they were dirty but they looked disgusting. On the floor was an Iron stain, the telly was so out of date and massive, the bench it was stood on was falling apart, the wall light was squewiff, the bed was small. I then went into the bathroom, the sink was cracked, and the walls in the bathroom had that horrible panelling on it. The room was stifflingly hot, and there was no way to make it cooler unless you had the window open and then you had all the noise of the traffic... so not a good nights sleep either. I went down stairs to talk to the guy about the room because as you can imagine I wanted it to be special. The guy behind the counter basically said that if I wanted something nice i should have booked the delux room..... Appalling.... my advise.... its a great location, but the hotel, never again....

Reviews.Title: “Very basic hotel, the only positive thing is its location”
Reviews.Author: kvi001
Reviews.Content: When our first choice of hotel wasn't available anymore, our travel agent suggested this one. The location was good, close to the Gloucester Road metrostation and some of the best museums in London (Natural History, V&A, Science Museum...). So far the positive news. The room was very basic: old furniture, old wallpapering, single glazing in the windows etc. The 'bathroom' was beneath all modern standards, the breakfast " buffet" offers toast and cornflakes, that's it. The hotel seriously needs some renovation but I guess the owner doesn't want to spend the investment.

Reviews.Title: “A step back in time and not in a good way”
Reviews.Author: WicklowNiftyfifty
Reviews.Content: Two other residents said this hotel was closing. Well not before time. I had to move rooms twice before I found an acceptable room and I had to pay extra for a double, but at least the basin wasnt cracked, the room smelt less musty and the grey curtains didnt have holes in it. Its like the hotel has stopped in a time warp of the 1980's, nothing has been updated since. The brochure describes it as a 'classic' & 'traditional' hotel - yes this is true, its unique! The breakfast (continental) was bordering on pathetic. Dishwater tea/coffee, soggy toast, no fruit, no croissants. At Â£85 sterling a night, it might be cheap by London Hotel standards but its not worth it. Staff were friendly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Try somewhere else!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Fisherstravels
Reviews.Content: I was exceited by the hotel from the outside, but do not be fooled....the rooms are tiny and poor, dated and the beds are uncomfy. Take your own pillow and don't expect a cup of tea in your room as there were no T&C facilities either. Breakfast was supposed to be included, but this actually means that toats was included - you have to pay I think Â£8.00 for a cooked breakfast on top of the price quoted for B&B. Staff started rudley hoovering around us at breakfast as we were talking - just ask us to leave!!!! I would not go back here. The location was good but that was the only positive I'm afraid.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: magon121254
Reviews.Content: This is my second trip to Europe. Not wanting to be an Ugly American, I decided to stay away from the American chains, and give the locals my business. If the dog bites you once... The only thing going for this hotel is it's location. The neighborhood is great. The nearness to the tube station is also great. That's it! I was charged Â£69 per night. If it had been Â£13 it would have been a fair price, judging from hotels in the States as well as in Latin America. It's supposed to be three star hotel. Maybe in Somalia, because a three star hotel in Quito, Eucador, Lima, PerÃº or Guatemala City is a palace in comparison. My single room was the size of a large walk-in closet. The carpet was old, worn and none too clean. The bathroom was adequate, but tiny. Some genius installed a shelf/towel rack contraption at head level in the very narrow shower. I can't remember how many times I hit the side of my head on it. Needless to say, no real shower, just a hose type handheld shower, with some hooks on the wall to hold it. The bed was my main complaint. I like firm beds and have one at home. This bed, though, was just plain HARD! It was so old that the fabric on the box spring was torn, the wood frame clearly visible. Needless to say, I did not sleep well while there! I asked if there was an internet connection available for guests (I left my laptop in order to not have to deal with two carry-ons). I was told by the front desk clerk that they'd had one, but somebody had broken it. Which left me thinking that, considering the prices they charged, what was their excuse for not immediately replacing it? As stated, unless I get a specific recommendation from a trusted source, from now on I'm sticking to the American chains when in Europe. I bet they're no longer American to begin with, being open to investors from all over. And better to pay a bit more and know what you're getting. Perhaps when they start feeling the pinch of lost business, the locals will start offering a bit of quality to go along with the high pricing.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: bookowl1000
Reviews.Content: Excellent location in Kensington. It is in a safe neighbourhood, 5 mins walk from Gloucester underground station and there are plenty of shops, pubs and restaurants only 5-10min walk away (depending on direction), and it is ideally located for exploring London. When walked up I thought my husband had got the wrong place as I thought we could not afford to stay there. When I got to our room I could see why we got it so cheap â€“ well, Â£100 a night is cheap for such a good location in London. The lift was very small and 3 of us with bags could not fit in at the same time. Our room was light and spacious but was dated and shabby. It looked like it had not been decorated since the 80s; flowery bedspreads and curtains, pink walls with a flowery border, fake plastic marble in the bathroom. There was a lack of attention to detail, e.g. tv with fuzzy picture, a bedside light not working, marked and chipped paint work, tarnished taps, rusty plug holes and the enamel in the bath was coming away. The more you looked, the more you spotted. There were only two, quite thin pillows and I had to put a folded bath towel under my pillow to get comfortable. I did then sleep well as the bed was clean and comfy. We had a room overlooking the road but there was no noise as there was very little traffic. There was a hairdrier at the dressing table. A self-service breakfast consisting of cereal, toast, and yoghurt was included in the room price. Cooked breakfast was available at an additional coast, e.g. fried egg Â£1.50, full cooked Â£7.50. There were papers available to read over breakfast. There is a bar near the lobby that serves bar food. There were no tea and coffee facilities in the room, which is unusual for a British hotel. I would not recommend this hotel to someone after a romantic getaway or those who like luxury; if however you just want a place to lay your head in an excellent location and would rather spend your money when out and about, then this hotel is for you as it is good value for where you are staying. The hotel room felt somewhat neglected with regards to dÃ©cor but it was clean and comfortable, and I personally would rather not pay an exorbitant amount of money on a hotel just because it is in inner London.

Reviews.Title: “just plan on sleeping there-fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: Flojo430
Reviews.Content: Don't expect anything and you won't be disappointed. If you need fine linens and fluffy pillows-this is not the place for you!! I normally stay in a five star hotel, but I figured this hotel would be good enough after long days touring. The hotel is a 5 minute walk from the Gloucester tube station. It has fabulous dining options within walking distance-both for dinner and breakfast. There is a lovely Polish lad there who was very accomodating with our requests. Our room was a triple and was VERY SPACIOUS. If you need the extra room pay the few extra dollars. it's worth it. Request a room in the back where it's a little quieter. We did not eat breakfast here. In this neighborhood and for this price all you should expect is a bed.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location but no value”
Reviews.Author: London_Lad61
Reviews.Content: The Cranley is in a superb location for anyone wanting to visit the sights and sounds of London. The hotel lift is tiny, you would not get more than 2 people with big bags in there at one time, the room we had was small-ish but it was clean. The bed was not the most comfortable in the world, caused me and my fiancee back ache!, and did not like the fact there was only one pillow each in the room with no spares in the room for those who require more. The TV was ancient and only had channels 1 - 5 and then a couple of random Italian channels which was quite surreal!! The best thing about this hotel is absolutely the location but offers no value for money at all.

Reviews.Title: “A lie”
Reviews.Author: scientistTGN
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel because it was one in the list of recommended by the Imperial Collage. In order to decide one and also because I had previous problems with bad hotels in London, I checked the pictures in the website (now I know that I should also check the trip advisor). In the website they show a nice and big charming victorial style rooms decorated in a beautiful style. But what you find there is a tacky 4 m2 room + toilet. I am not exaggerating, in the room just fit a little and uncomfortable bed touching the wall an the other wall was Â½ meter near the bed, in fact the TV was hanged on the wall over the bed because was not space on the only table that has the room. And what can I said about the toilet, the walls was â€œdecoratedâ€� with a plastic simulating marble absolutely kitsch, combined with a plastic floor and old washbasin (but not antique). The staff was kind except one cross-eyed man in the reception. I am not consider that 90 pounds per night is a cheap price to receive this kind of quality hotel, but in fact the quality of the hotels is not established by the price but by the starts, it was a 3 stars hotel and then it should has the same quality of other 3 start hotels in Europe. But what really disappoint me is that they are lying in their website, showing room pictures that are extremely far from the reality, so I consider that this is a fraud and it is the second time that happens to me in London but not in other countries (perhaps I was lucky in other places).

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in a good location!”
Reviews.Author: mayday2073
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for one night. Glad I came across this one at the last minute. About a 7 minute walk from Gloucester Road tube station. Once you exit the tube station on Gloucester Rd. make a right and head straight through about 3 sets of traffic lights where you will find Cranley Garden Park and across the street is the hotel. Easy access to the museum areas (Victoria & Albert and Natural History Museum), Brompton Oratory, a Tesco Express across from train station, several coffee shops, restaurants and pubs. Check in was fast, friendly and easy. My room was somewhat large with comfortable twin beds (the duvet and blankets could do with a wash). I was glad the room was very warm so that I did not have to use them. Room had television, closet area, hair dryer and windows that could be opened for fresh air. The hotel is located near streets that are a little busy but not too bad later in the night. The room overlooked Cranley Gardens Rd. The only downside was the faulty removable snake shower head. Hard to take a shower when it kept falling down. Bathrooms are a bit tiny but okay. Breakfast is very basic. Not much choice but cold cereal, yogurt, toast, tea and juice. You can order a Full English Breakfast (which is a bit pricey). Other than that I would recommend this hotel and would likely book here again on an overnight trip to London. It's a good base for a night or two in the city.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Hotel in a Very Good Location”
Reviews.Author: BostonVeteran
Reviews.Content: I stayed here twice, once in 2007, and once in 2008. My room the first time was very quiet - I never heard anyone else. The second time my room was much nosier, near a swinging door that slammed every time someone went by. The staff was very nice. The breakfast was bland and limited, but generous.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel but wouldn't go back”
Reviews.Author: ROO80
Reviews.Content: We were booked into this hotel with family in 3 rooms all together. We asked for rooms together but they weren't. 2 of the rooms were ok, our room and whole floor smelt of damp and the wallpaper in the restaurant and bar looked loke they suffered with it too. Breakfast was poor, no choice except cold toast and 3 cereals. There was no tea making facilities in room and cost Â£2 a cup from bar. The lift didn't work, not much good with a pushchair. Rooms were a good size but need upgrading.

Reviews.Title: “Small, modestly priced hotel does a good job.”
Reviews.Author: CAZ485
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights at the Cranley Gardens, which has a terrific location in South Kensington - close to restaurants, museums, tube and bus service. My room was small by American standards, but comfortable with an unremarkable view. Overall, quite adequate for my needs. The staff was generally friendly and helpful. Breakfast was continental, but very good. This isn't The Ritz, but as a small, modestly priced hotel, Cranley Gardens does a good job.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff, Needs a Few Upgrades”
Reviews.Author: dubuquer
Reviews.Content: South Kensington is my preferred location when stayling in London, but it's expensive. Note: if the postcode isn't SW7 it's not really in South Kensington. This hotel is about equidistant from the South Kensington and Gloucester Road tube stations, so transportation is good and there's a variety of shopping, dining, and services nearby. By London standards the room rates are reasonable; I paid Â£75 per night for a single room. The multilingual reception staff was most helpful and friendly. They told me how to get to Victoria Coach Station by bus during a 48-hour tube strike. They went after a non-metered minicab operator that overcharged me and extracted a Â£5 cash refund for me. They were helpful with concerns about the room safe and the 110v electrical outlet. Kudos to the staff! The breakfast buffet was good but not incredible: coffee, tea, juice, cereal, toast, etc. Hot toast and soft margarine was a nice change from the cold toast and frozen butter often served at breakfast in London. About six cereal choices, but no Weetabix (probably the most popular cereal in Britain). Only two juice choices, orange and apple. And no croissants. I've had worse breakfasts in Britain, but I've had better, too. Then there's the lift (elevator) -- possibly the world's slowest, and definitely one of the smallest. It says capacity is six persons, but surely that's a joke, right? Then there's the beds. I stayed in two different rooms on separate stays at the beginning and end of a three-week visit. Very small -- what would be called a twin size mattress in the US. And unquestionably the least comfortable beds of the seven hotels I stayed in during the trip. No, make that downright lumpy and uncomfortable. The room itself was tiny by American standards, but not unlike other single rooms in Britain. Lighting was adequate for reading and writing. Low-flow shower head and water-conserving toilet were annoying. Calls to British 0800 numbers from phone in room were free. No access charge, no per-minute charge.Unusual among UK hotels. There was a computer in the reception area where guests could access the Internet for free. Also unusual among UK hotels. Don't go in expecting it to be like an American hotel. Even the hotels in Britain with American names on them are not like their US counterparts. And this one is above average in meeting the expectations of American travelers. For the price, this is a good value hotel in a good neighborhood in central London.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Friendly staff. Good breakfast. Adequate accomodation.”
Reviews.Author: daknees
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights in a twin room overlooking the street. The main problem was the plumbing. The toilet wouldn't flush and there was very little water pressure for the shower. We reported the toilet and the gentleman at the desk was very apologetic but didn't seem surprised. When we returned to our room at the end of the day, it had been fixed, but still only flushed on about every 10th try! The mattresses were hard and the pillows thin and the TV did not work. The size of the room was better than expected and there wasn't much noise from the street. The decor was decent. The breakfast room in the basement was pleasant though there were water stains on the wallpaper. There was a good selection of food (3 or 4 cold cereals, prunes, yogurt, a selection of juices, fresh toast, cheese etc and a hot breakfast was available at extra charge. We paid about $165/night (Canadian) through our travel agent. and by Canadian standards this would be a rip off, but from what I've read, by UK standards it was about average. I would rate this as 2 star accommodation, not 3.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, terrible rooms”
Reviews.Author: PRB_Manly
Reviews.Content: Wife & I plus three kids (11,14,15) stayed here about 5 nites in late December as part of a 5week trip thru Europe. This was one of the least comfortable hotels we stayed in. Location is great - near stations and the hopon/hopoff tour bus. Rooms were very ordinary - beds most uncomfortable in our 5 wks of touring and bathroom probably the worst - mainly because of the shower having next to no pressure. Reception and bar staff were helpful (the non-english ones) - the others were pretty ordinary. Breakfast just OK but the pub down the road much better. Real shame because the location and uoutside of the hotel is great. Price was high compared to others we used but this might be typical of London more than anything else.

Reviews.Title: “Fine - says it all really.”
Reviews.Author: Dad_of_Daisy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with seven colleagues for an overnight stay on Business. The hotel was booked by a third-party organisation, so I had no expectations. A pleasant reception area with a small bar, and a friendly smile from the female receptionist, complemented by a disinterested scowl from her male colleague. The same lady greeted me by name when I returned from dinner later, which was a pleasant surprise. My room was on the fourth floor, which I reached via the slowest lift I have ever ridden in - from then on I used the vertinigous stairs. The room itself was a bit shabby, with a thin blanket over the topsheet and a mattress due for replacement. The bathroom was in desperate need of refurbishment, particularly the shower. My biggest bugbear in a hotel room is an inadequate shower, and this was a poster model - an over-the-bath extension with calcified holes in the head and a wildly veering temperature. This was probably because I was on the fourth floor and showered in the morning - my colleague used hers the evening before and said it was fine - little consolation for me standing covered in suds waiting for the spray to become hot/cold enough to duck beneath for a few brief seconds. Breakfast seemed pretty acceptable, although I only had time for a bowl of cereal as service doesn't begin until 7.30am; usually too late for me when on business. The coffee was far too strong for me to drink - usually I find myself moaning about how weak it is, so this was like drinking treacle (but coffee-flavoured). Overall, If I was booked into this hotel again, I probably wouldn't change it, but if I was booking for myself, I'd be looking elsewhere. Not horrific, not amazing - just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, very well situated, you feel like home, warm welcome”
Reviews.Author: yazfrance
Reviews.Content: This hotel is first of all very well situated. Service was just excellent, very helpful at the reception to help you with any question. The hotel is confortable and cosy, the staff make you feel like home We had a very pleasant stay and really advise this hotel Good price for the service + location too. Nearby underground

Reviews.Title: “Very very nice”
Reviews.Author: SaveManu
Reviews.Content: My family is a regular client of this hotel, which is very clean, quiet and very comfortable. The staff is really friendly, caring all the needs of the guests. The hotel is located in a quiet area of south kensington, close to the tube station and well connected with buses. I have already recommended this hotel to some friends because the prices are highly competitive and the quality really good. It is perfect for families not seeking for international hotel chains that, it has to be mentioned, very often in london do not accept children and infants. Compared with other hotels we visited in London with this range of price, this is definitely the best.

Reviews.Title: “Shared the room with a mouse!”
Reviews.Author: Thymetotravel
Reviews.Content: Room small and dreary. Bathroom unsuitable for large people - you can sit on the toilet whilst dangling your feet in the bath and washing your hands in the sink all at the same time. Worst was sharing the room with a mouse. Staff uninterested in our complaint - said this had never happened before. However, mice are not lone creatures. Ours was no doubt feeding the wife and kids and in communal living with aunts, uncles, cousins etc!!! Staff made no effort to find us alternative accommodation - we found ourselves on the streets of London at midnight with a minor in tow. Receptionist, who had become quite rude and arrogant, took our contact details for the Manager, who of course was not available, to contact us - three months later we are still waiting. No refund or compensation offered - in fact receptionist thought we were going to pay for the night we had to leave!!! We dealt with the situation in a calm and dignified manner and left the hotel foyer quietly - the hotel ought to consider itself fortunate we did not loudly announce to all in reception and the packed lounge the reason for our departure, as many other disgruntled guests would have done. Next time we will stay at a larger chain such as Jurys, where the receptionists are polite to customers and not this small greedy hotel. I see from previous comments the manager feels he is giving guests a complimentary breakfast - are we really to believe he is doing this out of the goodness of his heart and not taken food purchase into consideration when setting the room prices??? Incidentally, whilst at the reception, like other comments we also had three other people complaining about the cold, lost keys etc. South Kensington is indeed a delightful area - please please please find yourself a hotel to match.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: bygeorgew
Reviews.Content: This is a very basic hotel in a wonderful location. It is a small hotel so that makes it nice. Rooms are very basic - no coffee, tea, kettle, etc. But there is a free internet connection in the lobby for all guests. Gloucester Road and many restaurants, shops, Tesco Express is just across Old Brompton Road. I found staff at the front desk and elsewhere to be very friendly and helpful. We were there when the fire in the Tunnel happened and they were very helpful to guests trying to make new connections to Paris and the continent. Rooms are small but clean. Breakfast was good with a supply of cereals, fruit and staff member to help with fresh toast. The hotel could use some work but I found it fine and I was impressed by the staff. We even opted to stay and extra night.

Reviews.Title: “First trip to London”
Reviews.Author: OttawaTraveller17
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Cranely Gardens earlier this month when I visited London on my own. It was recommended to me by a friend who had stayed there, and who's parents often stay there (they schooled in London and go back twice a year). I quite enjoyed the hotel and found the staff very friendly. Can't beat the location which is central to all manner of London sights. As for the room: the TV and remote in my room worked, and the bed was fine although the bed linens were old and the cover had a stain. Can't speak to the heating as it was warm enough in September not to need it. No AC, but this is London so you just open the window. The room was very quiet and as others have mentioned quite small, but I thought reasonable for the location and price. The bathroom was basic which was fine, although on the last day I had serious problems with the hot water. I only received a dribble coming out the shower although there was plenty of hot water coming out of the tap. This seems a common problem in England as it appears most showers have some kind of water-saving device attached. I had the same issue at a hotel I stayed at in Hastings. The breakfast is basic and filling and tasty: toast (various kinds of bread), james and preserves, various cereals, canned fruit (peaches while I was there), slices of cheese, milk, coffee and tea. It filled me up nicely for days of long walking in London (typically left at 10am and returned at 8pm). Locally there are endless restaurants and pubs and I became a fan of The King's Arms which is to the south west of Cranley Gardens on Fulham Rd. Used the free internet station when I could (it was often busy in the evenings) and since I was travelling alone spoke often with other travellers and staff in the bar area. It was all in all a great experience and I plan to return to the Cranley Gardens when I'm next in London.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: martine001
Reviews.Content: great location lousy hotel. Very old beds, very old hotelrooms, staff not friendly. when we complained about our room they said "this is what you paid for, this is what you get"!!!! It wasn't that cheap!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect too much!”
Reviews.Author: Blueeyes51
Reviews.Content: Don't waste your time if your looking for comfort, the rooms are real small and the bathroom, well, you better know what your going to do before you go in, other wise you have to back out and turn around. The beds are small, a double is as large as you can get, Pillows are flat and very small, Lamb Table crambed next to bed, Bad storage space, Doors will not fully open hits lamp table. No Movies in every room, as posted on web site, No Internet service in each room as posted on the web site. The TV's are old and the remotes don't work. About 6 Channels, 2 in English. Nothing to watch on Tv after being out all day long As for the Staff, at the front desk, they run Hot & Cold, don't ask too many questions, They give you direct answers, but offer no help, Breakfast is ok, I like toast, Free coffee and orange juice. I would not stay there again, nor would I recommend it it anyone, It's noisy and crambed, small rooms, small haul ways, small elevator, says 6 person, must be migets standing on each others shoulders. I'm 5'10" and weight 200 lbs and I took up a quarter of the elevator. with luguage 2-3 people max. The only good thing about this Hotel was location. If you want some comfort in your stay, Stay some where else, If your a cheapskate, this place is perfect, nothing to expect. I did ask the desk clerk for a differnt room and was turned down, I stayed there 7 days and just toughed it out. It was the low point of mine and my girlfriends vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Sweethearts in London”
Reviews.Author: podo30
Reviews.Content: I definetly recommend this hotel to everyone. The area is georgious, the rooms are big, and the hotel staff is incredibly helpul. The location is perfect because it is right near the bus and the underground. I couldnt have asked for a better stay.

Reviews.Title: “bring your thermals”
Reviews.Author: Swifty1609
Reviews.Content: just got back from a two night stay in Feb 08 Take our advice and read the previous comments as it's now only after the event that we have! to save money the heating is turned off during the night, one night I slept with my clothes on as I was so cold. We weren't the only ones complaining about this either. Room had no basic facilities such as a kettle for tea and coffee. The only two positives were that the staff were pleasant and it's a good location. To summarise we're never staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the best part of London!”
Reviews.Author: Marga88ca
Reviews.Content: This is such a great hotel! It is in the perfect area of London (South Kensington), close to the subway, nice shops, and just a lovely area with nice houses, apartment blocks, parks, etc. Itâ€™s an older hotel (converted apartment buildings), and not very fancy rooms, but comfortable, clean, and nice staff. I believe we paid abut 110 pounds a night, including taxes and breakfast for 2 people. For London, and for this part of London, this is a great deal. The other hotels in the area weâ€™d looked at were at least 70 pounds more. It is about a 10 pound trip by taxi from Victoria Station to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Place”
Reviews.Author: NycStudentTraveler
Reviews.Content: My experience with this hotel began rather badly, as I wasn't given a room until 1PM; I was at the hotel ready to check in around 9AM. The rooms aren't very big and they can get stuffy, as there isn't any air conditioning. Other than that, the overall service was good, and the staff was quite helpful. The rooms were clean and well serviced every day. The buffet breakfast included in the rate was dismal, but you can't really complain considering that it was free. The location is GREAT, and there are a lot of good places to get food, even for those on a tight budget, such as Tesco's. In all, I probably would consider paying a little more to stay in a better hotel, although this isn't a terrible choice. This hotel had been undergoing some face lifting during my stay, but it still wouldn't hurt hotel management to put at least a fan in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: beantown72
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and did not have a good experience. The rooms are extremely small, the beds are old and stiff, and there's no air conditioning. They are under staffed and didn't seem that helpful. Don't be fooled by the pictures on the internet. This place is only for someone on an extreme budget and who doesn't care about quality.

Reviews.Title: “Comments on Cranley Gartens Hotel - London (U.K.)”
Reviews.Author: Taiga_Husky
Reviews.Content: Just returned from one of our regular trips to London. We always try to stay in a different area. This time Chelsea/Kensington seemed the right choice. We generally book our hotels over the internet. However Cranley Gardens Hotel turned out to be a bit of a disappointment: it is worn out and needs some redecoration. The breakfast was included in the room price, and a good thing too - it was certainly not worth spending extra money on. Very basic and in our opinion the breakfast room needed a good cleaning. We had asked for a twin room at the back (quiet) and got what we wanted. Matrasses could do with some overhaul and the blankets were a bit worn - room and bathroom equipment were pretty basic. But, on the other hand, the room was large to London standards. Reception staff was friendly and helpful but staff at breakfast could have been a bit more cheerful - this is certainly appreciated in the morning ! Location is great though, very near to 2 tube stations (South Kensington and Gloucester Road) and to the Museums & Harrods, and lots of restaurants. Sorry, but we would not return to Cranley Gardens Hotel or recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Second Visit”
Reviews.Author: HorseShowDad
Reviews.Content: The staff earns the hotel an upgrade from "average" to "above average." My wife and I stayed here 21 years ago on a high school trip, decided to return with the kids for spring break. The hotel provides excellent value for the cost. The location is great, as is the staff. If the provided breakfast isn't to your liking there are many inexpensive options within a 5 minute walk of the front door. Our rooms were clean with some rough spots around the edges. The mattresses were lumpy, but we were expecting that based on other reports (we were in 106 and 108, the connecting rooms.) We did take our own pillows, which made a tremendous difference. If you don't want to blow your budget on a bed consider this hotel. We wanted the kids to experience quaint and quirky; we didn't want them to feel like they were staying at Holiday Inn in Orlando. Eddie Manning (Google will find him) collected us from Gatwick and delivered us to the hotel with the utmost efficiency and reversed the trip at the end of our stay. If you are traveling as a group of 3 or more he works out to be about the cost of the Gatwick Express with a cab on the city end. However, you get luggage assistance and a comfortable, relaxing drive with a local. Something you won't see on the train.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Islander77
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife for 7 nights in CG Hotel past April 2004 (i just created a my account here, so dont care for the delay!) and we spent a very good time in this hotel. Friendly staff, neat rooms (somewhat small but hey its London!), very good location. The breakfast is not plentiful, but who cares! Grab the butter and grab a nice white bread! I recommend it specially considering the location vs price ratio. You wont have luxury but you will have all your basic need fulfilled.

Reviews.Title: “At least the area was great...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Okay, granted... my first mistake was confusing Cranley Hotel with Cranley Gardens Hotel. The bad news: The beds are horrible in every single room... I put three blankets on top of the mattress and you could still feel the springs - awful and almost impossible to sleep. The breakfast consisted of toast, cereal, tea/coffee and canned peaches - they could actually do a bit better job with the breakfast. Also, although it is a 'no smoking' hotel, it stank of stale cigarette smoke. The good news: it is a great area... Harrod's, The Science Museum, The Natural History Museum... also, close to the tube stop. There are some wonderful pubs and coffee shops in the area. There are also small markets which were very reasonable. BUT I would suggest another hotel... and to the Cranley Gardens - GET SOME COMFORTABLE BEDS.

HotelInfo.Name: Cranley Gardens Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 8 Cranley Gardens | South Kensington, London SW7 3DB, England
